creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: herd of game animals running across scene; three of the animals are highlighted, two at far L, and one at R; animal at R turns head to look behind while running; a few dead trees against silhouetted thicket of trees in middle ground; pronounced wood grain texture and horizontal lines; rendered in browns, yellows, reds, and oranges
inscription: Bottom, printed: [One Day in East Africa. No. 4  ある日の東アフリカ], in pencil: [AP] [Toshi Yoshida 1981]
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: One Day in East Africa No. 4
